intro: Manglilla milleriana, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is a fleshy berry that turns from green to yellow or red as it matures. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats.
